intro: Schistostephium, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, narrow leaves, and small, daisy-like flowers. Schistostephium species are known for their hardiness and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions. These plants are often used in traditional medicine and for their ornamental value.
